edu.rit.draw.item

Class Arrow

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.rit.draw.item.Arrow
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Externalizable, Serializable

    public class Arrow
extends Object
implements Externalizable
    Class Arrow provides various kinds of arrowheads that can be added to the ends of a Line.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static Arrow NONE
      A nonexistent arrow.
      static Arrow OPEN
      An open arrow in the shape of a narrow triangle.
      static Arrow SOLID
      A solid arrow in the shape of a narrow triangle.

    • Field Detail

      • NONE

        public static final Arrow NONE
        A nonexistent arrow. The arrow size is 6.0.

      • SOLID

        public static final Arrow SOLID
        A solid arrow in the shape of a narrow triangle. The arrow size is 6.0.

      • OPEN

        public static final Arrow OPEN
        An open arrow in the shape of a narrow triangle. The arrow size is 6.0.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Arrow

        public Arrow()
        Construct a new uninitialized arrow. This constructor is for use only by object deserialization.

    • Method Detail

      • defaultSize

        public static float defaultSize()
        Returns the default arrow size. The arrow size is relative to the stroke width of the outline to which the arrow is attached.
        Returns:
        Default arrow size.

      • defaultSize

        public static void defaultSize(float theSize)
        Set the default arrow size. The arrow size is relative to the stroke width of the outline to which the arrow is attached. If not set, the default arrow size is 6.0.
        Parameters:
        theSize - Default arrow size.

      • none

        public static Arrow none()
        Construct a new nonexistent arrow.
        Returns:
        Arrow.

      • solid

        public static Arrow solid()
        Construct a new solid arrow with the default arrow size.
        Returns:
        Arrow.

      • solid

        public static Arrow solid(float theSize)
        Construct a new solid arrow with the given arrow size. The arrow size is relative to the stroke width of the outline to which the arrow is attached.
        Parameters:
        theSize - Arrow size.
        Returns:
        Arrow.

      • open

        public static Arrow open()
        Construct a new open arrow with the default arrow size.
        Returns:
        Arrow.

      • open

        public static Arrow open(float theSize)
        Construct a new open arrow with the given arrow size. The arrow size is relative to the stroke width of the outline to which the arrow is attached.
        Parameters:
        theSize - Arrow size.
        Returns:
        Arrow.

        public void readExternal(ObjectInput in)
                  throws IOException
        Read this arrow from the given object input stream.
        Specified by:

        Parameters:

      • draw

        public void draw(Graphics2D g2d,
        float width,
        double x,
        double y,
        double phi)
        Draw this arrow in the given graphics context. It assumes the graphics context's stroke and paint are already set to the correct values. The arrow is scaled to match the width. The arrow's tip is placed at the coordinates (x,y). The arrow is rotated so it points in the direction given by phi.
        Parameters:
        g2d - 2-D graphics context.
        width - Stroke width.
        x - X coordinate of the arrow's tip.
        y - Y coordinate of the arrow's tip.
        phi - Angle in which the arrow points (radians).
